alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 7:55AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect northeastern Aroostook County... At 755 AM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was 7 miles west of Woodland, or 13 miles northeast of Portage...moving east AT 30 MPH. Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Caribou, Fort Fairfield, Limestone, Van Buren, Portage, Mapleton, Washburn, Ashland, Easton, Woodland, Portage Lake, Loring, Madawaska Lake, Fish River Lake, Nashville Plantation, New Sweden, Chapman, Connor, and Castle Hill. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Presque Isle and Caribou. State Highway 11 between Portage and Winterville. * Winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Travel is not advised during these heavy snow showers. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the snow showers pass your location. If traveling pull off to a safe location.
